title: Provides that an applicant shall receive assistance within the next business day if they are determined to be eligible for the food stamp program
summary: Provides that an applicant shall receive assistance within the next business day if they are determined to be eligible for the food stamp program.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2189

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Social Services

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  social  services  law, in relation to expedited
         service in the food stamp program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 95 of the social services law is amended by adding
    2  a new subdivision 12 to read as follows:
    3    12. WHENEVER A PERSON MAKES AN APPLICATION FOR  EXPEDITED  SERVICE  OF
    4  THE  FOOD STAMP PROGRAM PURSUANT TO SECTION 387.8 OF TITLE 18 OF THE NEW
    5  YORK STATE CODES, RULES, AND REGULATIONS, THE LOCAL DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL
    6  SERVICES SHALL PROVIDE SUCH FOOD STAMPS TO  SUCH  APPLICANT  WITHIN  THE
    7  NEXT  BUSINESS DAY IF IT IS DETERMINED THAT THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE TO
    8  PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect on the thirtieth day  after  it  shall
   10  have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06251-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation to expedited service in the food stamp program
